snippet: The move breaks with a practice that had narrowed Oscar voting in certain categories to those who had seen the nominees on the big screen.
abstract: Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences, in break with practice of narrowing Oscar voting to those who had seen films on big screen, says it will provide members with DVD versions of nominees in best foreign film and best documentary short categories, while allowing all voters to cast a final ballot in those races.
lead_paragraph: The move breaks with a practice that had narrowed Oscar voting in certain categories to those who had seen the nominees on the big screen.
